page.title: 12THE BLUECOAT SCHOOL,OLDHAM
page.content: AN OLDHAM HATTER BUILT BLUECOAT AS A BOARDING SCHOOL FOR ORPHAN BOYS IN 1834.IT IS NOW A MIXED COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL BUT IT ONLY TAKES CHURCH OF ENGLAND PUPILS ALTHOUGH,IN THE FUTURE,IT COULD BE OPEN TO ANYONE.1130 PUPILS ATTEND BUT THERE IS STILL A WAITING LIST.IT IS POPULAR BECAUSE IT UPHOLDS ITS TRADITIONS BUT KEEPS ABREAST OF MODERN TIMES.A PUPIL" IS EXPECTED TO CONDUCT HIMSELF IN SUCH A MANNER AS TO BRING CREDIT TO HIMSELF AND THE SCHOOL AND TO ALWAYS SEEK THE BEST".THESE OLD MOTTOES STILL APPLY.IT'S A HAPPY SCHOOL WITH EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR BOYS AND GIRLS AND IT GETS RESULTS.EVEN IN THIS AGE OF UNEMPLOYMENT,MOST OF THE STUDENTS FIND WORK OR GO INTO FURTHER EDUCATION.PUPILS BELIEVE THAT A GHOST HAUNTS THE SCHOOL.WE KNOW THAT A MAID COMMITTED SUICIDE THERE MANY YEARS AGO
